page.title: 20Community care in Thurlow
page.content: Thurlow is a typical estate village with a strong feudal feeling in its best interpretation. The owner extends a benevolent stewardship covering many aspects of the residents' lives. He ensures that roads are snow ploughed in winter, takes steps to protect the ecology, maintains old buildings of special interest, helped to fund the building of the sports pavillion, resurfaced the tennis courts, maintains the sports ground and helps to care for tehupkeep of the church. The estate is the single biggest employer in the village, retaining a benevolent interest in its retired workers. Estate life affects villagers' free time, some acting as beaters during the winter shoots and large numbers supporting the hunt(of which the owner and his wife are joint masters)following on horseback,car etc
